2008T901-d-09-12-08-BB.Narrative: ON SEPTEMBER 12, 2008, CSXT TRAIN E50310 WAS WESTBOUND ON THE NORTH MOUNTAIN SUBDIVISION OF THE BUCKINGHAM BRANCH RAILROAD.  AT 0847, THE TRAIN CREW REPORTED TO THE BB RAIL TRAFFIC CONTROLLER THAT THEY HAD A REPORT OF A CAR WITH WHEELS SLIDING.  THIS WAS DETECTED BY A BB FLAGMAN NEAR MILEPOST 182.4.THE CAR WAS 79 DEEP (MWCX 100593, EMPTY COAL HOPPER).  THE TRAIN WAS STOPPED; IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE CAR WOULD BE SET OUT AT IVY SIDING.  THE CAR HAD SIGNIFICANT BUILDUP ON THE WHEELS; THE TRAINCREW WAS DIRECTED TO MOVE THE TRAIN AT "WALK" SPEED TO THE SIDING AND SET THE CAR OUT. AT 0903, THEBB RAIL TRAFFIC CONTROLLER RECEIVED AN EMERGENCY PHONE CALL FROM THE NORFOLK SOUTHERN RAILROAD POLICE THAT THE TRAIN (ON THE BBRR) HAD A DERAILED CAR IN IT.  THE RAIL TRAFFIC CONTROLLER IMMEDIATELY DIRECTED THE CREW TO STOP THE TRAIN.  THE CONDUCTOR FOUND THE SAME CAR WITH ALL WHEELS ON THE GROUND;THE CAR REMAINED UPRIGHT.  THE BRAKE PIPE WAS INTACT; THE TRAIN DID NOT GO INTO EMERGENCY.  THERE WERE NO INJURIES TO THE TRAIN CREW.

0730-d-09-18-08-MBTA.Narrative:
STUDENT ENGINEER AT THROTTLE, OFFICIAL ENGINEER ON RECORD
TRACK MAINTAINED BY AMTRAK, INCIDENT UNDER INVESTIGATION  
AT APPROXIMATELY 1:37 PM AMTRAK'S SOUTH STATION TERMINAL DISPATCHER REPORTED TO THE MBCR CHIEF DISPATCHER, SOUTH-SIDE, THAT TRAIN NO. 614, A REVENUE SERVICE, WHILE INBOUND TO TRACK3 LEAD TOWER 1, DERAILED. IT WAS REPORTED THAT THE FOURTH CAR, #709 AND THE FIFTH CAR, #932, HAD DERAILED AT MILE POST 228. IT WAS ALSO REPORTED THAT THERE WAS A SMALL FIRE UNDER LOCOMOTIVE 1126 THATHAD BEEN EXTINGUISHED. THERE WERE NO EMPLOYEE OR PASSENGER INJURIES. PASSENGERS WERE DETRAINED THROUGH THE HEAD END DOOR WITHOUT INCIDENT. THERE WAS AMTRAK RAIL INFRASTRUCTURE DAMAGE AS WELL AS SIGNIFICANT DAMAGE CAUSED TO THE WHEELS AND TRUCKS OF CARS 709 AND 932.

UPON INSPECTION THE CREW FOUND THAT THE SECOND THROUGH THE SIXTHCARS WERE DERAILED. FOURTH CAR FROM THE LOCOMOTIVE HAD PICKED THE RIP LEAD SWITCH WHICH CAUSED THE DERAILMENT.

080087-d-09-26-08-WE.Narrative: 222-25 WAS PULLING INTO #3 TRACK IN BREWSTER YARD AT THE SAME TIME THE 523-25 YARD JOB WAS SHOVING EAST ON THE LEAD THE CONDUCTOR OF THE 523-25 FAILED TO VERIFY THAT THE SWITCH FOR #9 TRACK WAS LINEDFOR THE YARD JOBS MOVEMENT INTO #9. THE CONDUCTOR WAS RIDING THE SHOVE AND WHEN HE GOT CLOSE ENOUGHTO VERIFY THE POSITION OF #9 HE FOUND IT LINED NORMAL FOR THE LEAD. THE CONDUCTOR JUMPED OFF THE SIDE OF THE CAR AND GAVE THE ENGINEER A STOP SIGNAL BUT THE MOVEMENT DID NOT GET STOPPED IN TIME AND RESULTED IN THE LEAD CAR TR 527268 OF THE 523-25 STRIKING CSXT 222856, LW 76042, WE 6930, AND CAGX 98022 OF THE MOVING 222-25.
